fields.description:
There are a few situations that result in users being fisheye but not crucible users (e.g. users created while there are fe licenses available but you have run out of crucible licenses then you add crucible licenses).

When these fe only users log into crucible for the first time they should become crucible users if there are crucible licenses avaibable in the same way they would the first time an ldap/crowd user logs in.

To remedy this situation it would be advantageous to add a couple of bulk edit functions to the the user admin so that all users, or even all users from a group, can be made crucible users in one go.
fields.summary: Non-crucible users should automatically become crucible users if licenses are available

fields.description:
Currently there are many parts of Crucible / Fisheye where the Project Name / Repository Name is listed in a "when created" list.

Examples:
Typical sorting of the Project lists can look like this:
** CR - Default Project
** Appmw-foobar-crprj Appmw Foobar Project
** MFuntime-crprj MFuntime Project
** EAplugs-crprj  EA Plug-in Project

A server with 100+ projects is near impossible to use.

As of Crucible 1.6.5a, the following lists are not sorted:
* Default page for Fisheye+Crucible - Crucible Projects
* Crucible Project Dashboards - Project Listings
* Crucible Create Review page - Project Listing
* Crucible Comment Search 'Project' -- Project Listing on search page


Other items that need to be sorted:
* Moderator Listings drop-down listing
* Author Listings drop down listing
* Reviewer Check-box Listings

The Comment Author on the comment search page is sorted surprisingly.
fields.summary: Ensure all Crucible Project Listings are sorted Alphabetically
Add "value-exceeds-size" warning to backup client

fields.description:
When doing a restore, we should warn people that they should do a backup first as their data will be overridden, do you wish to proceed... kind of message.
If people wish to automate restores via a script, we can provide them with a flag like --force to prevent this message from appearing (i.e. the default behaviour is to warn). This way we can prevent newbies, etc from deleting their data.
fields.summary: Add "sure-to-overwrite-data" warning on commandline client
Make varchar length definitions consistent across dbs

fields.description: Crucible comes with "remember my login" functionality which forced to be on. That means as long as the user hasn't logged out, the computer will remember the user. It would be great if this option is configurable; turn it off so that user's cookies expire when they close the browser.
fields.summary: Allow "Remember my login" functionality to be configurable

fields.description:
Our versioned metrics system creates a number of problems when dealing with metrics and reporting.
* Non current metric versions are not displayed in metrics
* Consolidation of metrics not possible (renaming, merging etc)
* Metric value identifiers are not consistent across versions, causing dubious results

This could be overcome by using a versionless metrics system. Notes:
* Three actions on metrics/values:
*# Rename
*# Disabled (value no longer available)
*# Deleted (all instances are removed from comments)
* Solves complexity issues with mapping metrics to metric versions to reviews/comments
* Allows for unique metrics definitions per project
fields.summary: Versionless Metrics System

fields.description:
I'd like to see more options for controlling diff context than None, Less, More, and Full. Going between Less and More gets me 2, 3, or 5 lines of context. That's just not enough. I frequently have to go to Full and then I find myself scrolling scrolling scrolling with some of the larger files we have on this project.

Why put a limit on "More", anyway? Have more/less just add/subtract 50% context and let the user decide how far out they want to go - 2, 3, 5, 8, 12, 18, etc. Or provide a drop down with a lot of options in it. It's really important to us to provide a lot more options than the 2, 3, and 5.
fields.summary: The "none, less, more, full" options are too limited

fields.description:
If you select some lines then hit "Keep as draft" an error box comes up that has a couple problems.

The error box is "Your comment wasn't added because no text was provided" and it has a Reload and Close button.

First issue is: what's the reload button for? Does it ever make sense to click that? If I hit the Reload button then the entire page refreshes and I lose my place. All of the files I had expanded are all collapsed now and it's scrolled to the top. Can't see how this link is useful at all.

The other issue is that I can type some text into the box that's still open, hit Post, Save as Draft or Cancel, and the error box "Your comment wasn't added" remains up. I'd expect it to go away either when I start typing, based on a timeout, or when I hit any of those other buttons to deal with the comment.
fields.summary: Error for no text in a comment saved as draft is odd

CRU Defect-> JIRA Subtask creation

fields.description:
At the moment we create a minimal Crucible Revision for all paths in a changeset. We did this for two reasons, 1) to create an ID to refer to the revisions details, and 2) to help us display extra information about the revision and improve performance when we view the change set page again.

when we create a revision we have to commit it to the database, which is rather slow, especially for very large change sets. (e.g. around 8.5 minutes for 12k revisions or 42ms/revision)

Since we now don't show many/any details apart from the path it may be possible to hold off creating a revision until they are used in a review.

This may be tricky since we probably use the id everywhere in the JSPs now.
fields.summary: No longer create minimal revisions on changeset view?

fields.description: According to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Review+Service+-+Reviews#ReviewService-Reviews-GetReviewDetailsthroughCustomFilterCriteria you can filter on a number of review attributes, such as title substring. However description substring is not one of them. Please could you add, this would help me a lot with http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=31005&tstart=0.
fields.summary: allow ability to filter on description substring using the REST api

fields.description:
When adding a single file manually to a review (using the Files-tab in Manage Files) by navigating to a branch and then clicking the checkbox of the file, actually adds that file from the trunk.
This seems to be caused by the way the revisions are ordered in the file's pull down box.

The workaround is to always open the pull down box and select the proper revision, but it's more intuitive to ensure that the branches in the pull down are ordered so that the branch that is browsed is the one that gets selected.
fields.summary: Adding a single file from a branch, adds the trunk version.

fields.description: Add the default repository to the XML returned by the Crucible [Project Service|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Project+Service].
fields.summary: Add "Default Repository" to Crucible ProjectsService

fields.description:
As JIRA, Crucible should be able to produce a backup that does not contain any sensitive data so customers can provide an anonymized backup archive for support cases.
This could be implemented by substituting every character in every user-provided string with a fixed character. Entity ID's and other auto-generated keys should not be changed.
fields.summary: Anonymization of the backup data
Multiple RemoteConfluence instances cause duplicate cache names

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce. 

Create a changeset user an author with username as "test@host". 

1) Index the repository in fisheye. 
2) In fisheye navigate to the repository. On the left if you constraint to auhtor test@host you see the correct changeset. 
3) Go to crucible > Create new Review, select "test@host" in the author constraint. The author name will be changed to test%40host and the you will see no changesets. 
4) Modify the URL from test%2540host to test%40host and you will see the correct changeset

fields.description:
This is a catch-all jira for the process of rebuilding the FishEye site to enable us have flexibility, accessibility, and a 2.0 approach.

The end result will deliver a site in Semantic HTML that is based on reusable components, AJS (Atlassian JS), jQuery, and advanced CSS.
Success will see the site better able to respond to company needs for growth and change.

Sub tasks will include:
1) Rebuild page as a template
2) Create a mirror page for each on the current site - use broad strokes, first pass to include H1 for purpose, then flesh out from there.
3) Create a set of component widgets to reuse.
4) Update any behaviour JavaScript to jQuery and/or AJS as appropriate
5) Update any ajax
fields.summary: Mirror FishEye site in Semantic HTML, jQuery, AJS, and 2.0 CSS

fields.description:
Backup/Restore need to be able to drop the current database and then create a database of any version for importing old data.

The process is dropDb(), createTables(int version), (insert data), addConstraints(), update().

To do this we will ship and store schema creation scripts for each type of database supported. The scripts will be broken into:-
* dbname-tables-version.sql
* dbname-constraints-version.sql
* dbname-drop-version.sql

the dbspecific scripts will be stored in a separate directory, currently hsql, mysql, postgresql.
(not part of this jira) upgrade scripts will be stored in separate db specific directories too.
fields.summary: package schema for backup/restore

fields.description:
When a user creates a new review and their username is the same name as a author, or they have applied a author mapping in their profile then the changeset tab will automatically add the author constraint restricting to the current user's commits. 

This can be confusing for new users who think they cannot see the latest changesets. 

We should add a small note or warning under the changeset tabs, that the author constraint has been added (we should do this for any constraints).
fields.summary: Add note or warning that author constraint has been applied when creating new review.

fields.description:
I think Crucible should have in-page links for methods whose signatures and/or bodies are shown elsewhere in the review so users can easily follow the flow within the review.

For C# and Java, the most efficient way I can think of to recognize a call to a method or property (or an instantiation of a class) in the review is:
1) to have the program only search the blocks of text that will be shown in the review,
2) search for alphanumeric words immediately preceding an open parenthesis or immediately following a period that itself immediately follows another alphanumeric word.
3) declarative occurrences of the strings would have access and return types preceding and/or extends/implements/parameter types/brackets following.
4) collect the strings that match the conditions in #2 in a list and the strings that match the conditions in #3 in another list and replace all occurrences from list 2 with the string wrapped in an anchor link that points to the appropriate location in list 3.

Not sure how many languages share a similar concept/syntax for method, property, and class, but it seems like this could even be genericized and perhaps even made configurable.
fields.summary: Hyperlink calls to methods etc

fields.description: I'd like to be able to move files around in a review so that I can order them by window/page and then by application layer.
fields.summary: Allow user to order files in review

fields.description:
When strings are serialized to XML, all illegal characters must be properly substituted or encoded. Characters that are forbidden in XML (such as the lower ascii control chars) will be encoded as unicode sequences by the writer in "Java-style": 0x01 becomes: "\u0001". The reader decodes the unicode sequences again.

This will be implemented as an XMLStreamWriter and XMLStreamReader.
fields.summary: Unicode Character Substitution for XML

fields.summary: Add the ability to create a crucible review from a confluence page.

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

This is mostly seen when trying to configure Jira Fisheye Plugin, but can also occur if you are trying to login using the Rest API. 

The error throw in your Jira logs will look like:

{code}
2009-05-19 14:02:29,838 http-8080-Processor25 ERROR [fisheye.rest.fisheye.FishEyeRestAuthenticationManagerImpl] Failed to authenticate user 'username': http://FISHEYE_HOST:8060/rest-service/auth-v1/login?password=********&userName=username returned 500 Internal Server Error
2009-05-19 14:02:29,838 http-8080-Processor25 ERROR [jira.ext.fisheye.FishEyeManagerImpl] Failed to retrieve FishEye repositories from http://FISHEYE_HOST:8060/ 
java.io.IOException: Failed to authenticate with FishEye. See logs for more details.
	at com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.rest.fisheye.FishEyeRestAuthenticationManagerImpl.authenticate(FishEyeRestAuthenticationManagerImpl.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.rest.fisheye.FishEyeRestAuthenticationManagerImpl.authenticateWithCrucible(FishEyeRestAuthenticationManagerImpl.java:58)
{code}

In your fisheye-error.log.* logs you see:

{code}
2009-05-19 16:07:14,311 ERROR [btpool0-3] org.mortbay.log sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl-invoke0 - /rest-service/auth-v1/login
com.sun.jersey.api.container.ContainerException: The ResourceConfig instance does not contain any root resource classes.
	at com.sun.jersey.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.processRootResources(WebApplicationImpl.java:774)
	at com.sun.jersey.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.initiate(WebApplicationImpl.java:671)
	at com.sun.jersey.spi.spring.container.servlet.SpringServlet.initiate(SpringServlet.java:66)
{code}

Your Fishye server is installed on a windows machine under a folder which contains a space, for example "C:\Program Files\crucible-1.6.6". 

To check where your Fisheye is installed go to Fisheye Administration > Sys Info/Support > System Info, and check your FISHEYE_HOME variable which represents where your Fisheye or Crucible is installed. 

h3. Workaround

Move your Fisheye or Crucible Installation to somewhere without a space, for example C:\crucible-1.6.6
fields.summary: Getting "The ResourceConfig instance does not contain any root resource classes" when trying to configure Jira Fisheye Plugin

fields.description:
When trying to use the Crucible reporting plugin, it crashes for most of my test reviews, those contain
review-comments!

I have found the culprit seems to be the REST service: GET /reviews-v1/<review id>/reviewitems/<reviewItemId>

The service  "GET /reviews-v1/<review id>/reviewitems/" works perfectly, but it doesn't know how to extract certain items.

I have attached the reviewItems retrieved for a specific review. It contains reviewitems CFR-145 ..CFR-150

But only GET /reviews-v1/<review id>/reviewitems/CFR-144 succeeds.
The rest cannot be retrieved using the GET /reviews-v1/<review id>/reviewitems/CFR-XYZ method
fields.summary: GET /reviews-v1/<review id>/reviewitems/X fail to return reviewitems of certain types

fields.description:
Maintenance Mode is to be used for administration processes that required the database to be stopped for any period of time. The intention is that this display a meaningful message to the user that the system is currently unavailable due to maintenance.

At a minimum prevent writes to the database and return a "Sorry Mate" type screen.
Would be nice to be able to send out a notification to users that the system is about to go into maintenance mode.
fields.summary: Set up maintenance Mode
